attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We hereby declare that the Township of Leigh in Lancashire (Greater Manchester), England is officially without a railway station and has been for the past 40 years. This makes our Township the largest population in Great Britain 'without' a Railway station in operation for the many residents and potential visitors. Currently the nearest stations are over 5 miles away from Leigh town centre in either Newton-Le-Willows (Merseyside) or Atherton. Both of which towns have no mentionable shopping, or National level Sporting facilities. Leigh does! Leigh Bus Station is the towns only public transport link. Bus services to Manchester and Liverpool are painfully slow (up to 2 hours to Liverpool) preventing Leigh capitalising on its' unique position between these two great national Cities.

Forty years ago Leigh had Two passenger stations operating an hourly service for local residents, Today it has no service at all. In 2009 the Government talk of seriously reducing air pollution, whilst local Leigh residents burn fuel resources without a more environmentally friendly alternative to chose. Like a regional train?
